availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Henry Rains (Mason County, Kentucky, farmer and merchant)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, farmer and merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Susan E. Bullock Rains in Mason County in June 1851. Father of Elizabeth P. Rains and Lillie Florence Rains. Married to Mary Elizabeth Bruer Rains in Mason County. Father of James M. Rains. Farmer with John M. Rains in Mason County in 1850. Merchant and flour dealer with John M. Rains in Maysville, Kentucky, in 1860. Employed Nora Lundygen as a servant in Maysville in 1860. Member of the Ringgold Lodge No. 27 of the International Order of Oddfellows.
